verse:
भिद्यते हृदयग्रन्थिश्छिद्यन्ते सर्वसंशयाः। 
क्षीयन्ते चास्य कर्माणि तस्मिन्दृष्टे परावरे ॥

terms.भिद्यते हृदयग्रन्थिः: bhidyate hṛdayagranthiḥ: The knot of the heart is pierced.
terms.छिद्यन्ते सर्वसंशयाः: chidyante sarvasaṁśayāḥ: All doubts are shattered.
terms.क्षीयन्ते चास्य कर्माणि: kṣīyante cāsya karmāṇi: His actions get dissolved.
terms.तस्मिन्दृष्टे परावरे: tasmin dṛṣṭe parāvare: When the supreme is realized.
terms: Tasmin dṛṣṭe parāvare: The verse concludes by stating that all of this happens when the supreme truth or the ultimate reality is realized. "Tasmin" refers to that supreme truth, and "dṛṣṭe" means when it is seen or perceived. "Parāvare" indicates the transcendent and immanent aspects of the ultimate reality.

meaning: Meaning:This verse, taken from the Bhagavad Gita (18.55), highlights the transformative power of spiritual realization.
